It depicts behavior or words that are perfectly calibrated to the situation - neither excessive nor insufficient. The phrase values appropriateness and measure. Modern usage describes well-calibrated responses, actions that are perfectly suited to their context.
description_tr: This idiom describes being exactly (恰) as (如) its (其) proper portion (分). It depicts behavior or words that are perfectly calibrated to the situation - neither excessive nor insufficient. The phrase values appropriateness and measure. Modern usage describes well-calibrated responses, actions that are perfectly suited to their context.
chineseExample_tr: 他的回應恰如其分。

example: Her argument was logically flawless.
chineseExample: 她的论点无懈可击。
description: This idiom describes having no (无) crack (懈) that can (可) be struck (击). It depicts something so perfect that no weakness can be found to attack. The phrase was used for impenetrable defenses. Modern usage describes flawless arguments, plans, or performances that leave no opening for criticism or attack.
description_tr: This idiom describes having no (無) crack (懈) that can (可) be struck (擊). It depicts something so perfect that no weakness can be found to attack. The phrase was used for impenetrable defenses. Modern usage describes flawless arguments, plans, or performances that leave no opening for criticism or attack.
chineseExample_tr: 她的論點無懈可擊。

meaning: Not a drop of water leaks
example: The security arrangements were absolutely watertight.
chineseExample: 安保措施滴水不漏。
description: This idiom describes not (不) a drop (滴) of water (水) leaking (漏). It depicts such thorough sealing that nothing can escape. The phrase was used for perfect containment or secrecy. Modern usage describes flawless execution with no gaps, plans so thorough that nothing is overlooked, or secrets so well-kept that nothing leaks.
description_tr: This idiom describes not (不) a drop (滴) of water (水) leaking (漏). It depicts such thorough sealing that nothing can escape. The phrase was used for perfect containment or secrecy. Modern usage describes flawless execution with no gaps, plans so thorough that nothing is overlooked, or secrets so well-kept that nothing leaks.
chineseExample_tr: 安保措施滴水不漏。

example: The police set up a dragnet to catch the fugitives.
chineseExample: 警方布下天罗地网抓捕逃犯。
description: This idiom describes nets (罗/网) of heaven (天) and earth (地). It depicts an inescapable trap covering all directions. The phrase was used for comprehensive dragnets or unavoidable fate. Modern usage describes thorough coverage that leaves no escape, whether police operations, surveillance systems, or any comprehensive trap.
description_tr: This idiom describes nets (羅/網) of heaven (天) and earth (地). It depicts an inescapable trap covering all directions. The phrase was used for comprehensive dragnets or unavoidable fate. Modern usage describes thorough coverage that leaves no escape, whether police operations, surveillance systems, or any comprehensive trap.
chineseExample_tr: 警方布下天羅地網抓捕逃犯。

example: Security was so tight that nothing could get through.
chineseExample: 安保密不透风。
description: This idiom describes being so dense (密) that wind (风) cannot (不) penetrate (透). It depicts impenetrable barriers or extremely tight security. The phrase was used for well-defended positions. Modern usage describes airtight security, complete secrecy, or any arrangement so thorough that nothing can get through.
description_tr: This idiom describes being so dense (密) that wind (風) cannot (不) penetrate (透). It depicts impenetrable barriers or extremely tight security. The phrase was used for well-defended positions. Modern usage describes airtight security, complete secrecy, or any arrangement so thorough that nothing can get through.
chineseExample_tr: 安保密不透風。

example: The plan was designed to be absolutely foolproof.
chineseExample: 计划设计得万无一失。
description: This idiom describes ten thousand (万) attempts without (无) one (一) failure (失). It depicts absolute reliability with no margin for error. The phrase was used for guaranteed outcomes. Modern usage describes plans or methods considered absolutely foolproof, though often used with ironic awareness that nothing is truly perfect.
description_tr: This idiom describes ten thousand (萬) attempts without (無) one (一) failure (失). It depicts absolute reliability with no margin for error. The phrase was used for guaranteed outcomes. Modern usage describes plans or methods considered absolutely foolproof, though often used with ironic awareness that nothing is truly perfect.
chineseExample_tr: 計劃設計得萬無一失。

example: She entered the exam with complete confidence in her preparation.
chineseExample: 她胸有成竹地走进考场。
description: This idiom describes having (有) complete (成) bamboo (竹) in one's chest (胸). It comes from the story of painter Wen Tong who visualized complete bamboo in his mind before painting. The phrase depicts thorough mental preparation. Modern usage describes having a clear plan or complete preparation before undertaking a task.
metaphoric_meaning: Have a well-thought-out plan; be well prepared
description_tr: This idiom describes having (有) complete (成) bamboo (竹) in one's chest (胸). It comes from the story of painter Wen Tong who visualized complete bamboo in his mind before painting. The phrase depicts thorough mental preparation. Modern usage describes having a clear plan or complete preparation before undertaking a task.
chineseExample_tr: 她胸有成竹地走進考場。

example: He had already mapped out the entire strategy.
chineseExample: 他成竹在胸，已经规划好了整个策略。
description: This idiom describes complete (成) bamboo (竹) being (在) in the chest (胸). A variant of 胸有成竹 with the same meaning - having thorough mental preparation. Modern usage similarly describes being fully prepared with a clear plan before starting, the confidence that comes from thorough preparation.
metaphoric_meaning: Have a well-thought-out plan; be confident
description_tr: This idiom describes complete (成) bamboo (竹) being (在) in the chest (胸). A variant of 胸有成竹 with the same meaning - having thorough mental preparation. Modern usage similarly describes being fully prepared with a clear plan before starting, the confidence that comes from thorough preparation.
chineseExample_tr: 他成竹在胸，已經規劃好了整個策略。

meaning: Moving blade with room to spare
example: The experienced chef handled the busy kitchen effortlessly.
chineseExample: 经验丰富的厨师在繁忙的厨房游刃有余。
description: This idiom describes a moving (游) blade (刃) having (有) room to spare (余). From Zhuangzi's story of Cook Ding who butchered oxen so skillfully his knife never dulled. The phrase depicts mastery with ease. Modern usage describes handling tasks with skill and capacity to spare, performing effortlessly what others find difficult.
metaphoric_meaning: Handle with ease; have skill to spare
description_tr: This idiom describes a moving (游) blade (刃) having (有) room to spare (餘). From Zhuangzi's story of Cook Ding who butchered oxen so skillfully his knife never dulled. The phrase depicts mastery with ease. Modern usage describes handling tasks with skill and capacity to spare, performing effortlessly what others find difficult.
chineseExample_tr: 經驗豐富的廚師在繁忙的廚房游刃有餘。

example: Having done this many times, the process was easy for him.
chineseExample: 做过很多次后，这个过程对他来说轻车熟路。
description: This idiom describes a light (轻) carriage (车) on a familiar (熟) road (路). It depicts easy travel without burden on a well-known path. The phrase captures the ease of doing something familiar. Modern usage describes tasks one has done so often they require little effort, the comfort of experience making work easy.
metaphoric_meaning: Be experienced; find something easy due to familiarity
description_tr: This idiom describes a light (輕) carriage (車) on a familiar (熟) road (路). It depicts easy travel without burden on a well-known path. The phrase captures the ease of doing something familiar. Modern usage describes tasks one has done so often they require little effort, the comfort of experience making work easy.
chineseExample_tr: 做過很多次後，這個過程對他來說輕車熟路。

example: After years of practice, playing the piano came naturally.
chineseExample: 经过多年练习，弹钢琴已驾轻就熟。
description: This idiom describes driving (驾) a light (轻) vehicle and approaching (就) familiarity (熟). Similar to 轻车熟路, it depicts ease from experience. The phrase emphasizes how practice makes difficult things easy. Modern usage describes the ease that comes with mastery, handling complex tasks effortlessly because of extensive experience.
metaphoric_meaning: Be very familiar with; handle with expertise
description_tr: This idiom describes driving (駕) a light (輕) vehicle and approaching (就) familiarity (熟). Similar to 輕車熟路, it depicts ease from experience. chineseExample_tr: 經過多年練習，彈鋼琴已駕輕就熟。

example: The artist's brush moved exactly as she imagined.
chineseExample: 艺术家运笔得心应手。
description: This idiom describes the heart (心) obtaining (得) and the hand (手) responding (应). It depicts perfect coordination between intention and execution. The phrase captures the experience of mastery where action flows naturally from thought. Modern usage describes performing tasks with complete facility, when skill has become so internalized that execution is effortless.
metaphoric_meaning: Work with great ease; have complete mastery
description_tr: This idiom describes the heart (心) obtaining (得) and the hand (手) responding (應). It depicts perfect coordination between intention and execution. chineseExample_tr: 藝術家運筆得心應手。

example: Her technical skills have reached the highest level.
chineseExample: 她的技术已经炉火纯青。
description: This idiom describes furnace (炉) fire (火) being pure (纯) blue (青). In traditional metallurgy, blue flames indicate the highest temperature and purest combustion. The phrase represents the pinnacle of skill development. Modern usage describes mastery that has reached the highest possible level, expertise refined to perfection.
description_tr: This idiom describes furnace (爐) fire (火) being pure (純) blue (青). In traditional metallurgy, blue flames indicate the highest temperature and purest combustion. chineseExample_tr: 她的技術已經爐火純青。

example: His magic tricks have reached an almost supernatural level.
chineseExample: 他的魔术已经出神入化。
description: This idiom describes transcending (出) the spiritual (神) and entering (入) transformation (化). It depicts skill so advanced it seems supernatural. The phrase represents the ultimate level of mastery. Modern usage describes extraordinary expertise that appears almost magical, performance so perfect it transcends normal human capability.

example: Her understanding of the field has reached an advanced level.
chineseExample: 她对这个领域的理解已经登堂入室。
description: This idiom describes ascending (登) the hall (堂) and entering (入) the inner room (室). From the Analects describing stages of learning - the hall is intermediate, the inner room is mastery. The phrase depicts progression to advanced levels. Modern usage describes reaching deep understanding, moving from surface knowledge to true expertise.

chineseExample_tr: 她對這個領域的理解已經登堂入室。

example: The student surpassed even his brilliant teacher.
chineseExample: 这位学生青出于蓝，超越了他杰出的老师。
description: This idiom describes blue (青) emerging (出) from (于) indigo (蓝). Blue dye derived from indigo plants becomes more vivid than the source. The phrase celebrates students surpassing teachers. Modern usage describes successors exceeding their predecessors, the ideal outcome of teaching where disciples achieve more than their masters.
description_tr: This idiom describes blue (青) emerging (出) from (於) indigo (藍). Blue dye derived from indigo plants becomes more vivid than the source. chineseExample_tr: 這位學生青出於藍，超越了他傑出的老師。

example: Despite starting late, the newcomer rose to lead the team.
chineseExample: 尽管起步较晚，新来者后来居上，成为团队领导。
description: This idiom describes latecomers (后来) occupying (居) the top (上). It depicts those who start later but ultimately achieve more than those who began earlier. The phrase encourages those behind. Modern usage describes come-from-behind victories, situations where late starters ultimately surpass early leaders through greater effort or talent.
description_tr: This idiom describes latecomers (後來) occupying (居) the top (上). It depicts those who start later but ultimately achieve more than those who began earlier. chineseExample_tr: 儘管起步較晚，新來者後來居上，成為團隊領導。

example: She ranked first in the national examination.
chineseExample: 她在全国考试中独占鳌头。
description: This idiom describes alone (独) occupying (占) the turtle's (鳌) head (头). In imperial examinations, the top scholar would stand on the carved turtle head at the palace. The phrase represents achieving first place. Modern usage describes being number one, winning top honors in any competition or field.
description_tr: This idiom describes alone (獨) occupying (佔) the turtle's (鰲) head (頭). In imperial examinations, the top scholar would stand on the carved turtle head at the palace. chineseExample_tr: 她在全國考試中獨佔鰲頭。

example: His unique artistic style set him apart from all others.
chineseExample: 他独特的艺术风格独树一帜。
description: This idiom describes alone (独) raising (树) one (一) banner (帜). It depicts establishing a unique position or style that stands apart from all others. The phrase values originality and distinction. Modern usage describes unique achievements, those who create distinctive approaches rather than following established paths.
description_tr: This idiom describes alone (獨) raising (樹) one (一) banner (幟). It depicts establishing a unique position or style that stands apart from all others. example: The restaurant offers a distinctive dining experience.
chineseExample: 这家餐厅提供别具一格的用餐体验。
description: This idiom describes separately (别) possessing (具) one (一) style (格). It depicts something with a unique character that distinguishes it from others. The phrase values originality and distinctiveness. Modern usage describes anything with unique qualities that set it apart, whether artistic works, businesses, or personal styles.
description_tr: This idiom describes separately (別) possessing (具) one (一) style (格). It depicts something with a unique character that distinguishes it from others. example: The architect's design showed remarkable ingenuity.
chineseExample: 建筑师的设计独具匠心。
description: This idiom describes uniquely (独) possessing (具) a craftsman's (匠) heart (心). It depicts original creative thinking with the skill of a master artisan. chineseExample: 电影导演匠心独运，创作出一部杰作。

example: The intricate jade carving seemed almost divinely crafted.
